page.title: 14THE CHURCH
page.content: In Forest Town there is a church called St. Albans where my little baby sister was christened. On Sundays services are held from half past ten to about half past twelve. The vicar's name is Rev. Robin Walford who, as well as being the vicar, looks after the graveyard and keeps it neat and tidy. There are lots of organisations in the church like Sunday School, mother and toddlers and young wives. Jumble sales and coffee mornings raise money for the church. There are weddings and funerals that take place in the church most of the time. The church services are for the congregation and for anybody else who wants to know about Jesus. A lot of the work in the church is done by the ordinary people who want to help in running their church.{JULIE SUTTON
